newsitem.title: TUNISIA: Tunisia-Emirates Bank first half net.
newsitem.headline: Tunisia-Emirates Bank first half net.

text.p: Tunisian-Emirates Investment Bank on Wednesday said it made a 1.48 million dinars net profit during the first half of 1996.
Figures for the same period last year were not available for comparison.
BTEI's net profits in 1995 amounted to 2.55 million dinars down from 4.59 million dinars in 1994.
The bank's capital was raised last year through a public offering, to 90 million dinars from 50 million, and BTEI has since been listed on the Tunis Stock Exchange.
The Tunis-based BTEI is a joint venture between United Arab Emirates public funds and the Tunisian state. ($=0.96 dinar)
